2303070.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303070
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 001
2303070.text: Salim ibn 'Abdullah said, "I never heard 'Abdullah ever curse anything." Salim mentioned that 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar said, "It is not fitting for a believer to be a curser."

2303080.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303080
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 002
2303080.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Allah does not love the loud and coarse nor the one who shouts in the markets."

2303090.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303090
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 003
2303090.text: 'A'isha reported that some Jews came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, "Poison ('sam' instead of 'salam') be upon you." 'A'isha said, "And upon you and may the curse of Allah and the anger of Allah be upon you!" The Prophet said, "Easy, 'A'isha, you must be gentle. Beware of harshness and coarseness." She asked, "Didn't you hear what they said?" He said, "Didn't you hear what I said? I repeated it to them and what I said about them will be accepted and what they said about me will not be accepted."

2303100.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303100
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 004
2303100.text: 'Abdullah reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "A believer is not a defamer nor a curser nor coarse nor obscene."

2303110.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303110
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 005
2303110.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "A person who is two-faced cannot be trusted."

2303120.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303120
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 006
2303120.text: 'Abdullah said, "The most blameworthy thing in a believer's character is coarseness."

2303130.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303130
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 007
2303130.text: 'Ubayd al-Kindi al-Kufi reported that he heard 'Ali ibn Abi Talib said, "The cursers are cursed."

2303140.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303140
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 008
2303140.text: Abu'd-Darda' reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Those who curse will be neither witnesses nor intercessors on the Day of Rising."

2303150.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303150
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 009
2303150.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The true person must not be a curser."

2303160.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303160
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 010
2303160.text: Hudhayfa said, "People do not curse one another without that curse coming true."

2303170.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303170
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 011
2303170.text: 'A'isha reported that Abu Bakr cursed one of his slaves and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Abu Bakr! The cursers and the true! No, by the Lord of the Ka'ba," and he repeated that two or three times. That very same day Abu Bakr freed one of his slaves. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came and said, "Do not do that again (i.e. curse someone)."

2303180.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303180
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 012
2303180.text: Samura reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Do not curse one another with the curse of Allah, not the anger of Allah nor with the Fire."

2303190.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303190
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 013
2303190.text: Abu Hurayra said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked, "Messenger of Allah, invoke a curse for us against the idolaters.' He replied, 'I was not sent as a curser. I was sent as a mercy.'"

2303200.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303200
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 014
2303200.text: Himam said, "We were with Hudhayfa when he was told, 'A man has a hadith going back to 'Uthman.' Hudhayfa said, 'I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "A mischief-maker will not enter the Garden."'"

2303210.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303210
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 015
2303210.text: Asma' bint Yazid reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Shall I tell you who is the best of you?" "Yes,," they replied. He said, "Those who remind you of Allah when you see them." He went on to say, "Shall I tell you who is the worst of you?" "Yes," they replied. He said, "Those who go about slandering, causing mischief between friends in order to separate them, and desiring to lead the innocent into wrong action."

2303220.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303220
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 016
2303220.text: 'Ali ibn Abi Talib said, "The person who says something indecent and the person who makes it known are equal as far as the wrong action is concerned."

2303230.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303230
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 017
2303230.text: Shubayl ibn 'Awf said, "It is said, 'Whoever hears something indecent and then spreads it is like the one who originated it.'"

2303240.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303240
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 018
2303240.text: 'Ata thought that an exemplary punishment should be carried out on anyone who makes adultery known. He said, "He has made indecency known."

2303250.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303250
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 019
2303250.text: Hukaym ibn Sa'd heard 'Ali say, "Do not be hasty, spreading and divulging secrets. Ahead of you lies a severe, distressing affliction and events which would take a long time explain - namely oppressive conflicts."

2303260.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303260
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 020
2303260.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "When you want to mention your companion's faults, remember your own faults."

2303270.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303270
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 021
2303270.text: Ibn 'Abbas spoke about the words of Allah Almighty, "Do not find fault with one another" (49:11) and he said that these words mean, "Do not attack one another."

2303280.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303280
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 022
2303280.text: Ad-Dahhak said, "It was about us (the Banu Salima) that these words were revealed, 'Do not find fault with one another' (49:11)" He went on to say, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to us and there was not a man among us who did not have two names. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, began to say, 'O so-and-so!' and they said, 'Messenger of Allah! That will make him angry!'"

2303290.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303290
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 023
2303290.text: 'Ikrima was heard to say, "I do not know which o f them, either Ibn 'Abbas or Ibn 'Umar, was giving his companions food, and a slavegirl was working in their presence. One of them said to her, 'Harlot!' He said, 'Easy! If she does not exact the hadd punishment (i.e. for slander) from you in this world, she will take it from you in the Next World.' The man said, 'And what do you think if it (what I said) is the truth?' He replied, 'Allah does not love anyone who greatly exceeds the sounds in speaking of indecencies."

2303300.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303300
In-book reference  : Book 15, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 15, Hadith 024
2303300.text: 'Abdullah reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said. "The believer is neither a defamer nor a curser nor outrageous nor obscene."
